elements.title: charoli tree (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Buddha is said to have sat under a charoli tree (example pictured) at Bodh Gaya for seven days without eating, drinking, washing, excreting, or lying down?

elements.title: C. A. Clingenpeel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that upon being named the head football coach at Central College, C. A. Clingenpeel declared that "we will win one game this year" – and was correct?

elements.title: an unidentified ancient temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an unidentified ancient temple may be the finest example of a "high place" in the Galilee?

elements.title: Rubel Phillips (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rubel Phillips was the first Republican to run in the Mississippi gubernatorial election since 1947 when he ran in 1963?

elements.title: Pronto Computers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pronto Computers' System 16 was one of the first computers in the tower form factor?

elements.title: Lee Chih-kai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the 2020 Olympics, Lee Chih-kai became the first gymnast competing for Chinese Taipei to win an Olympic medal?

elements.title: Victories Greater Than Death (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charlie Jane Anders wrote preferred pronouns into her science fiction novel Victories Greater Than Death because she thought that alien gender would be unclear to humans?

elements.title: a Milwaukee TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Milwaukee TV station lost a newsgathering vehicle when it fell through ice and into a lake – while reporting on ice safety?
